result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara M Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Total court costs due during term of supervision.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

AODA assessment and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
Absolute sobriety.
No controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.
Random testing.
To be employed 30 hours per week or attend school full-time.
Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular
Clerk confirmed with DOC agent that defendant has paid restitution and court costs in full and will discharge from probation. Hearing removed for 6/12/2019.

DOC agent contacted clerk. Defendant has paid restitution in full, she owes approximately $800 in court costs. He anticipates her paying this in the next week. If not paid, he will file paperwork for a civil judgment and hearing will be removed from the Court's calendar on 6/12/2019. He will notify the Court by 6/11 if payment was made in full.
Probation review hearing on June 12, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Sara M Stewart in court with attorney Rachel M Alme-Boaz.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1 thru 3 of the amended information.  Court is informed parties have entered into an agreements to the restitution amount. Court examines defendant, finds her guilty and renders sentence.

Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered.  Conditions of bail continue.

Defendant Sara M Stewart in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant regarding waiver.  Court accepts waiver and binds matter over.  Information filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State by Carol Crowley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Atty Alme Boaz advises the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties.  State requesting $1000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $1000 signature bond w/conditions:  no contact with MT or KT; absolute sobriety; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing to allow defendant time to retain private counsel.  Court orders matter adj to 3/20 at 8:45 am for status of prelim hrg.
